Method Detail

isThere

public static boolean isThere(java.lang.String s,
                              char value)
returns the true if character indicated by value appears in the String passed as the first parameter and false if it does not.

Parameters:
s - is the string to be searched through
value - the character you want to locate in the string
Returns:
true if it is there or false if it is not

count

public static int count(java.lang.String s,
                        char value)
returns the number of times the character indicated by value appears in the String passed as the first parameter

Parameters:
s - is the string of characters you'll search through
value - the character you want to find in the string
Returns:
the count of how many times that character appears

returnValue

public static double returnValue(java.lang.String s)
If the parameter passed does not contain a plus sign or a minus sign, return the value -1. If the string does contain a plus sign or a minus sign, you can assume it has a positive double before and a positive double after (there might also be spaces as appropriate).

Parameters:
s - the string hopefully of the form number+number or number-number for example: 1.23+4.56 (possibly with spaces (but not in the middle of a number))
Returns:
the value of the expression (so for this example 5.79)
